definition: lit. to set up a separate kitchen (idiom); to start from scratch/back to square one/to start of on a new path
other/another/separate/separately

to rise/to raise/to get up/to set out/to start/to appear/to launch/to initiate (action)/to draft/to establish/to get (from a depot or counter)/verb suffix, to start/starting from (a time, place, price etc)/classifier for occurrences or unpredictable events: case, instance/classifier for groups: batch, group
stove/furnace

kitchen stove/kitchen

sentences.english: Does such an administration operate within the political system, or supplant it?
sentences.chinese: 这种管治是在既有政制中运作，抑或另起炉灶？

definition: to start over from scratch (idiom)
to form one's own group or school of thought/to set up one's own business/to establish oneself
to live apart from parents (of married couple)/to achieve independence
to work on one's own/to work single-handed/individual farming
to take an alternate route (idiom)/to find an alternative/to take a different approach/to blaze a new trail
old wine in a new bottle (idiom)
lit. new wine in old bottles; fig. new concepts in an old framework/(loan idiom from Matthew 9:17, but fig. meaning is opposite)
to seek/to strive for
bold and decisive
to improve one's family's social status by moving up in the world/to switch one's allegiance to a new patron
stuck in the old ways (idiom); refusing to acknowledge new ideas/stagnating and conservative
(idiom) to continue in the same old rut/diehard conservative attitudes
to resume one's old trade (idiom)
to recruit soldiers and buy horses (idiom); to raise a large army/fig. to expand business/to recruit new staff
to get a better job somewhere else (idiom)/to seek alternative employment
arrogant/to put on airs/(business etc) to expand/to enlarge/to do sth on a big scale
